alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued November 10 at 2:53PM EST until November 10 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley and Charleston. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Water over roadways. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 250 PM EST, Doppler radar indicated bands of moderate rain associate with Tropical Storm Nicole moving across Downtown Charleston and other areas adjacent to the Charleston Harbor. Several roads remain closed in Downtown due to flooding. The risk for minor flooding continues. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Mount Pleasant, Downtown Charleston, James Island, Fort Sumter, Daniel Island, West Ashley, Folly Beach, Sullivan`s Island, Fort Johnson, Charleston Naval Complex, Charles Towne Landing, Sullivans Island, Marion Square, Columbus Street Terminal, Medical University Of South Carolina, Ravenel Bridge, Patriots Point and Mount Pleasant Waterfront Park.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
